intro: Guatteria juninensis, commonly known as the Junín guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Bolivia. This evergreen shrub typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments at moderate elevations. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged oppositely on the stems. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries that serve as a food source for various wildlife.
